sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"不幸的"之意。
means: miserable ： 指因贫穷、不幸或屈辱等外部因素给人造成精神痛苦、烦恼或肉体折磨，令人同情和可怜。
wretched ： 多指由于疾病、担忧、忧伤等造成的不幸和痛苦，在外表上显得沮丧、可怜、失望，语气比miserable强。
unhappy ： 侧重指精神上的不快或失望。
sorry ： 常作礼貌用词，表遗憾、婉惜。也指说话人表示同情、悲哀等，感情色彩较强。

sentence.Network_en: Miserable, and unexpectedly lonely, she went in search of Jean-Paul.
sentence.Network_cn: 内心痛苦、突感寂寞的她去寻找琼－保罗。

sentence.Network_en: There was nothing at all in this miserable place to distract him.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个鬼地方根本没有什么东西可以让他分心。

sentence.Network_en: Our speed over the ground was a miserable 2.2 knots.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们在接近地面时的航速仅为2.2节。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French misérable, from Latin miserabilis 'pitiable', from miserari 'to pity', from miser 'wretched'

entry.def: If you are miserable, you are very unhappy.

example.ex: I took a series of badly paid secretarial jobs which made me really miserable...
example.tran: 我做了几份薪酬微薄的秘书工作，这让我非常郁闷。

example.ex: She went to bed, miserable and depressed.
example.tran: 她伤心而沮丧地上床睡觉。

entry.tran: (地方、形势)令人难受的，令人抑郁的
entry.def: If you describe a place or situation as miserable, you mean that it makes you feel unhappy or depressed.

example.ex: There was nothing at all in this miserable place to distract him.
example.tran: 这个鬼地方根本没有什么东西可以让他分心。

entry.def: If you describe the weather as miserable, you mean that it makes you feel depressed, because it is raining or dull.

example.ex: It was a grey, wet, miserable day...
example.tran: 那是阴郁灰暗、潮湿多雨的一天。

example.ex: It was very cold, damp and  miserable.
example.tran: 天气非常寒冷潮湿，令人难受。

entry.tran: 脾气坏的;不友善的;乖戾的
entry.def: If you describe someone as miserable, you mean that you do not like them because they are bad-tempered or unfriendly.

example.ex: He always was a miserable man. He never spoke to me nor anybody else.
example.tran: 他的脾气总是很糟。他从不跟我或其他任何人讲话。

entry.tran: 远远不足的;非常差劲的;少得可怜的
entry.def: You can describe a quantity or quality as miserable when you think that it is much smaller or worse than it ought to be.

example.ex: Our speed over the ground was a miserable 2.2 knots...
example.tran: 我们在接近地面时的航速仅为2.2节。

example.ex: It has so far accepted a miserable 1,100 refugees from the former Yugoslavia.
example.tran: 迄今为止，从前南斯拉夫接收的难民只有区区1,100人。

entry.def: A miserable failure is a very great one.

example.ex: The film was a miserable commercial failure both in Italy and in the United States.
example.tran: 这部电影在意大利和美国均遭遇票房惨败。

sentences.sentence: "a message of hope for suffering humanity"
"the shabby room struck her as extraordinarily pathetic"- Galsworthy

means.word_mean: 4. of very poor quality or condition;

sentences.sentence: "deplorable housing conditions in the inner city"
"spent a wretched night on the floor"
"the company donated a miserable $100 for flood relief"
"almost depleted his miserable store of dried beans"

stems_affixes.word_buile: miser可怜的+able可以……的→adj.痛苦的,悲惨的
miser可怜的+y状态→n.痛苦,悲惨,不幸
com共同+miser可怜的+ate表动词→共同可怜→同情

means.word_mean: 悲惨的, 不幸的, 可怜的

sentences.en: We have led a miserable life.
sentences.cn: 我们过了一段悲惨的生活。

means.word_mean: 令人痛苦的; 令人不快的

sentences.en: They started their holiday on a miserable day.
sentences.cn: 他们假期开始时天气很不好。

sentences.en: He was born in a miserable family.
sentences.cn: 他出身于一个贫困的家庭。

means.word_mean: 卑鄙的, 可耻的, 可恶的

sentences.en: What a miserable old devil he was!
sentences.cn: 他是多么可恶的吝啬鬼呀！

sentences.en: It was miserable of you to make fun of him.
sentences.cn: 你取笑他, 这是可耻的。

jushi.english: He was born in a miserable family.
jushi.chinese: 他出身于一个贫困的家庭。

jushi.english: They started their holiday on a miserable day.
jushi.chinese: 他们假期开始时天气很不好。
